title: Obama Progress Poster Typeface
content:
[http://www.ninjavspenguin.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2008/04/obey-obama...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012062654/http:/www.ninjavspenguin.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2008/04/obey-obama-progress.jpg "http://www.ninjavspenguin.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2008/04/obey-obama-progress.jpg")

please help,  
I am hoping someone can identify the typeface used for the word progress on the bottom of the poster.  
Thanks
author: tanyaholbrook

comments.content:
H&F Knockout

[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100013](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012062654/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100013 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100013")

Looks like No. 48 Lightweight or No. 49 Featherweight

Its House Industry’s Chalet Comprime which is a compressed variant of their Chalet font.

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=11](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012062654/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=11 "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=11")

Naw. It’s Knockout for sure.  
Obama = H&FJ fonts.

On his blog He mentions that he chose Chalet Comprime for the obama poster.

"Finally I moved on to the type treatment. For the sake of continuity with the campaign’s own materials and Shepard’s earlier posters, I chose a typeface that somewhat resembled what they had been using. I ended up going with House Industry’s Chalet Comprime which is a compressed variant of their Chalet font. I converted the type to a shape layer to work out the kerning and sizing and created a mask based on the shape."
Well, it looks more like Knockout than Chalet Comprime.

With some squooshing, an added stroke, and I really think they manipulated the flair on the foot of the R ... I think the splines on the S had to be manipulated too. Oh and the notch under the beard of the G. But this was started with Chalet Comprime Cologne Sixty.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012062654im_/http:/typophile.com/files/squo2-comp_5093.png)
You know. They might claim Chalet, but the R and S, and the E even, are much closer in Knockout.
Chalet impersonating Knockout, they call that progress? :D

It may be purely anecdotal, but Tobias Frere-Jone and Shep Fairy were both at RISD at the same time. Or maybe you all knew that, and I am stating the obvious. Not that this is necessarily cause for a real connection professionally.
Thank you everyone for all your help!
